Reviews.Title: “last minute budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daaride
Reviews.Content: we were almost stranded in Venice as we missed the last train back to milan (our base). We walked around and checked out room availability for one night for all the hotels in and around the main station and this one provided the best value for a 2 star hotel (e60). Guy on the front desk was most helpful with his easy manner and eagerness to help

Reviews.Title: “Its what it says on the tin !”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyF48
Reviews.Content: My and my girlfriend booked this hotel due to its price and location. The price was good and the location was exellent. 2min walk from the train staion and 5min walk from the bus station and 1min walk from the ferry terminal that will take you wherever you want to go in Venice. Everything in Venice is triple the price of the UK unless you buy your booze from co-op (which we did) and sat next to the river in the sun. Co-op was 10mins walk away. The hotel is clean and we had a shared bathroom but the rooms are basic but do have a T.V with english speaking channels. There is no lift but the amount of walking you do in Venice the the steps over bridges etc made the third floor stair climb seem irrelevant. Our room was next to the ally way above reception and at night it was a little noisy with people comming and going but we like that urban vibe so it didn't bother us. The breakfast was OK. With a hangover most mornings a large jug of coffee. orange juice and a croissant is all you need (but all you got !). The recption staff were helpful and spoke english and had a laugh with us and the maids were thorough and friendly. We only paid about Â£38 per night for the room with breakfast and I thought this was a fair price in an over priced city. I have travelled all over the world and stayed in Cesars Palace to a hut in India. I was more than happy to stay at the Dolomiti and would recomend it to the more seasoned, level headed traveller. For price and location it has to be an 8/10. Venice is amazing but watch your wallet. It will chew the life out of it !

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in the right place”
Reviews.Author: BenWalker20
Reviews.Content: Others may have grumbled but we were very pleased with the location, price, helpful staff, in fact everything.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff and so helpful”
Reviews.Author: Josurd
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed stay here very much.. They looked after bags until we were ready to leave.. Helped with restaurants and breakfast was adequate..

Reviews.Title: “Only good for Location”
Reviews.Author: ramblerandagambler
Reviews.Content: This place really has nothing to offer beyond its proximity to the train station. Breakfast (one biscuit) was particularly sad, no wireless, and the rooms were entirely basic. This hotel is only good for large groups for cheap school trips; however, there are better hotels on this street with more services for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScealtaSaoire
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel was perfect - it was right beside the train station and when it comes to Venice you should definitely stay close to wherever you're leaving from. We were leaving by train so it was perfect for us. Compared to the rest of the island though it would take about 15-20 minutes to get to Rialto Bridge and obviously longer for St. Mark's Square. The hotel was kept very clean and there was a fan in the room instead of A/C. We did have a problem with our booking because of 1800hotels so the hotel were very nice in letting us stay in the hotel at the price we had originally booked it for. Breakfast was included and it was basic but it was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: emsy945
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst i've stayed in. Small rooms, no tv, no internet access, no lift, no air conditioning, noisy, weird man at the front desk! He kept complaining about the heat/humidity and starting crapping on about hoping we all burn and die! So scary! The breakfast was horrible! All they had was coffee (which i dont drink), cereal, juice that tasted like very sweet cordial and all we got given was a plain crossaint and packets of breadsticks. It's expensive to stay in Venice but i would seriously recommend splurging a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor our on line reservation”
Reviews.Author: rtb77
Reviews.Content: This hotel charged us extra for rooms with bath that I had already paid for in or on-line booking with 1800hotels .com. Beware of this scam. Although this was what I expected out of Venice, it was the first encounter with a hotel world-wide that did not honor our reservation with the proper confirmation in hand. The street below was also very noisy. I would not recommend this hotel especially for older travelers as they do not have an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and service-what more could one ask?”
Reviews.Author: lkhc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Dolomiti at least 20 times since June of 1984. It began when I arrived in Venice with my son and his best friend and the Dolomiti was represented at the train station. I enjoyed that so much, I stayed again 2 years later with my 2 daughters and four of their friends. Over the years I have stayed with other family members and friends there and in 2004, took the oldest daughters of both my son and daughter to stay there. We have all loved it. I have always loved having a room that overlooks the monastery gardens and the sound of the bells in the morning is a wonderful wake-up call. While the rooms have been updated and air conditioning has been added over the years, I actually enjoy opening the windows (providing it isn't too hot) and enjoying the fresh air. I have no doubt I will be back again. The family and staff are always so welcoming and helpful and I love the pate for breakfast. I have recommended the hotel to many of my friends who travel with teenagers and even school groups and I have not heard one negative word.

Reviews.Title: “Exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: SydVicious
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, great location on a quiet street. Only one block from the train station. Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly, good value for clean comfortable room with decent breakfast. Not really for people looking for luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: anni21
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Just blocks from the train station. We arrived on a rainy day without prior reservations and the hotel staff were very accomodating and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: rzrz
Reviews.Content: nice hotel close to train station helpful front desk staff very good value for clean comfortable room with decent breakfast but not for people looking for luxury hotel is older but is renovated slept well here and is on a quiet street

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: chefchik
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here and enjoyed it very much. It is just around the corner from the train station, so we could walk there and not hassle with pulling luggage too far or taking water taxi's or a water bus. The room was very clean and simple, although a little cold and stark, it was perfectly fine for us. We had a quad room which was a little tight with luggage but we managed fine. The bathroom was good sized with a window to let fresh air in. The air conditiion was outstanding, it was very hot during our stay and I'm not sure how we would have done it without the air. The staff was extremely kind and very helpful. There is no elevator which was a little tough due to the fact we were on the 4th floor. We are stonger now because of it though. We did not eat breakfast there so I'm not sure how it was. We found it good to get out and find a pastry and coffee. The location made this a great choice for us and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. If you can find it this restaurant named ZUCCA was outstanding!! It is across the canal from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: sttimmj1
Reviews.Content: IDEAL LOCATION.ROOMS CLEAN BUT BASIC.We went with a large party of students but unfortunately some were placed in rooms without AC although the travel company told us that all rooms had AC.Turned out the older part of the hotel did not have AC. Some staff were very friendly others were not helpful at all. bREAKFAST VERY POOR

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: babycakesCork
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location in venice and was very near the train station. I found the staff very helpful with excellent english! we were very pleased with the standard of the shared bathrooom which was always very clean. But make sure to bring a towel of your own!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly convienient hotel”
Reviews.Author: deelited
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small, but after a previous visit to Venice this year, it was pretty much what I expected for the price. The location is excellent, it's an easy base to find on the waterbus, as you just head for the railway station and it's a 2 minute walk from there. It's also a great start for a leisurely walk to Rialto or St Marks square. Breakfast was basic, ham or salami, bread roll, cheese spread, Melba toast, pate... the usual. Staff were polite and friendly and rooms were very very clean. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone without a massive budget who wants to stay in the centre of venice.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: kirinhoney
Reviews.Content: The room was nice but a bit too small for 3 persons. The staff were friendly. One staff was very helpful. He gave us a lot of advices. The location was great, just really next to the train station. The breakfast was also nice-had hot croissant.

Reviews.Title: “Good locationj”
Reviews.Author: Lau_Shu
Reviews.Content: Great location, only a couple of mins walk from the station. No bridge to cross, great if you have heavy luggages. Reception guy was helpful. We were being put on the 3rd floor, with no lift, we had to struggle to get our room. Room is spacious and clean. Bed is too soft. With no air-con nor fan, if anyone could survive the heat in the summer, I doubt you could survive the bites from the mosquitoes. We didn't dare to leave the windows open, the mosquitoes remains we found on the walls and ceilling were HUGE! Toilet was on the 3rd floor, shower on the 2nd floor. Not a problem. In the middle of the nite, I was woken up by a guy from the reception, shouting at someone about not registering at the reception. Walls were thin like paper, I could hear him shouting like he was next to me. Don't think I would stay there again. Lot's of other choices for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dolomiti was in a great location after exiting Central Station. I'm glad we decided to stay here instead of dragging our luggage on a water taxi and having to go deeper into Venice to find our hotel. The location was prime as the water taxis were so close which made getting around easier. A one time ticket on the water taxi is 5 euros, so if you are going to be there for an extended time, buy a 24-hour ticket for 11 euros or a 72-hour ticket for 24 euros. Anyhow, the room was small, but clean and nice. No TV, but who needs a TV in Venice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast wasn't much, just coffee and a croissant. We had a pair of pants and a shirt ironed and on checkout, it was 10 euros. Moral of the story: Ask before you accept.

Reviews.Title: “Good simple hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dolomiti is a short walk from the train station. The back of the hotel looks across to the station maybe 200 metres distant. The hotel entrance is a 1 minute walk down a lane off the Grand Canal. The hotel is family run and I found all the staff to be very helpful and polite. I booked through their own website and had quick replies and confirmation all in English. Our room had recently been renovated and was extremely clean and well kept. Linen was clean and fresh. It looked kind of 'Ikea-ish' The bathroom was very clean and the shower was powerful and always had hot water. Our room had air-conditioning. Breakfast room and downstairs are more 'homely', in need of a bit of renovation treatment. Breakfast is simple; coffee/tea and a croissant and rolls and orange juice. There was no TV in our room, no mini-bar, and no room service and there is no lift / elevator, if any of this is important to you. This was one of the cheaper hotels (for Venice) I came across before I made a booking therefore I did not expect luxury but I was pleased with how it was.

HotelInfo.Name: Dolomiti Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 73-74 | (Calle Priuli ai Cavalletti), 30121 Venice, Italy
